item.title: First PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Additions For January Leaked
item.content:encoded:
The first handful of games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in January 2026 have been leaked ahead of the official reveal.

Known leaker Billbil-kun has revealed the first six games that will be announced.

For PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium subscribers, five of the games being added this month are Resident Evil Village (PS5 | PS4), Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth (PS5 | PS4), Expeditions: A MudRunner Game (PS5 | PS4), A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead (PS5 | PS4), and art of rally (PS5 | PS4).

For Premium subscribers who enjoy classic games, the catalog will also see the PlayStation 1 classic Ridge Racer added. As mentioned in the report, both Ridge Racer 2 and Ridge Racer Type 4 are already available in the Classics catalog.

All of the games, per the report, will be available starting January 20.

While those six games are likely based on Billbil-kun’s track record, it should be taken with a grain of salt until the official announcement. It’s also unknown just how many games will be added to the library this month. The full reveal of the rest of the games is expected to happen on Wednesday, January 14.

What do you think of the first batch of games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog this month? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the new gameplay trailer for Carmageddon: Rogue Shift. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Nintendo Year In Review Finally Released For 2025
item.content:encoded:
Two weeks into 2026, and Nintendo has finally released its Year In Review for Switch and Switch 2 players.

To access your Nintendo 2025 Year In Review, simply go to the recap’s landing page and sign in with your Nintendo Account. From there, you’ll see stats such as the number of games you played, and the amount of time spent on the system.

In addition, you’ll find out the games you played the most, the types of games you favored, and a month-by-month breakdown of how much you played.

“Your Nintendo Switch 2025 Year in Review has arrived,” Nintendo said on social media. “Check out not only your 2025 adventures, but memories from past years with your Nintendo Switch as well.”

Nintendo joins other platforms like Steam and PlayStation with their “wrapped” or year in review features. The only one of the major platforms that didn’t release one for 2025 was Xbox. Microsoft skipped this year, reportedly, due to budget constraints.

As far as why Nintendo waited so long to release this time around, that hasn’t been mentioned. Past versions came in the weeks leading up to Christmas, making 2025’s the latest one yet.

What did your Nintendo Year In Review reveal about your playtime on the Switch and/or Switch 2? Leave your recap details down in the comments, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the new gameplay trailer for Carmageddon: Rogue Shift. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
